comments.body:
this is a global config, right?
are you sure the other components do not need it in run-time?
Only going by CI here. It is only used by bindings-akka afaik so if the JSON API doesn’t need it, I expect other clients probably also don’t need it.
sounds good.... I forgot that we test `daml sandbox` startup as part of the CI build. So, we are good.

diffHunk:
@@ -72,20 +66,48 @@ def install_java_deps():
             "io.dropwizard.metrics:metrics-graphite:4.1.2",
             "io.dropwizard.metrics:metrics-jmx:4.1.2",
             "io.dropwizard.metrics:metrics-jvm:4.1.2",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-api:1.22.1",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-core:1.22.1",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-netty:1.22.1",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-protobuf:1.22.1",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-services:1.22.1",
-            "io.grpc:grpc-stub:1.22.1",
-            "io.netty:netty-codec-http2:4.1.37.Final",
-            "io.netty:netty-handler:4.1.37.Final",
-            "io.netty:netty-handler-proxy:4.1.37.Final",
-            "io.netty:netty-resolver:4.1.37.Final",
-            "io.netty:netty-tcnative-boringssl-static:2.0.25.Final",
+
+            # Bumping versions of io.grpc:* has a few implications:
+            # 1. io.grpc:grpc-protobuf has a dependency on com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java, which in
+            #    turn needs to be aligned with the version of protoc we are using (as declared in deps.bzl).
+            #    ScalaPB also depends on a version of protobuf-java, but for the most part we expect here a
+            #    version mismatch between ScalaPBs declared protobuf-java dependency and the version on the
+            #    classpath doesn't matter.
+            #
+            # 2. To keep TLS for the Ledger API Server working, the following three artifacts need be updated
+            # in sync according to https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/master/SECURITY.md#netty
+            #
+            # * io.grpc:grpc-netty
+            # * io.netty:netty-handler
+            # * io.netty:netty-tcnative-boringssl-static
+            #
+            # This effectively means all io.grpc:*, io.netty:*, and `com.google.protobuf:protobuf-java
+            # need to be updated with careful consideration.

comments.body: Trying out 2.12.11 scala version to see if that works as smoothly as 2.12.8 did on ci.
Looks like it's working. Okay now @SamirTalwar-DA ?

I chose a version of `mockito-scala` that is quite old but it's the latest one compatible with the version of `scalatest`/`scalactic` we are using (3.0.5).

For as much as I like being on the latest version of a library, I downgraded the Mockito Java libraries accordingly to make sure we don't have weird runtime behaviors due to incompatible libraries.

https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.mockito/mockito-core/2.24.0
https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.mockito/mockito-scala_2.12/1.1.2
Correction: I chose a version of `mockito-scala` that is quite old but it's the latest **that defines as its dependency** the version of `scalatest`/`scalactic` we are using (3.0.5).

These versions now match those introduced within rules_scala internally. Unfortunately, we still have to list these dependencies here even though we're overriding them below. Otherwise the corresponding `@maven//` targets are not generated.
@miklos-da think you have to rerun bazel run @unpinned_maven//:pin and check in the gen'd maven_install.json file from that command
Thanks for the note -- will do that.
For consistency, you might want to depend on 2.9.9 for jackson-annotations as well.

@miklos-da i believe mirrored what auth0 had as their dependencies defined in the maven central pom here - i believe even jackson itself is inconsistent in which versions it uses.  but will double-check to make sure

yeah just double-checked -- jackson databind 2.9.9.3 actually depends on annotations 2.9.0 in maven central so matched that to avoid diverging . https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.fasterxml.jackson.core/jackson-databind/2.9.9.3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25179017/70436238-cdc57180-1a56-11ea-80ba-210a631215ce.png)
